bank.question: What does ～方[かた] mean when attached to the stem of a verb?
Which sentence correctly uses ～方[かた] to express 'How to write kanji'?
options: 漢[かん]字[じ]の書[か]き方[かた]を学[まな]びます。
漢[かん]字[じ]を書[か]く方[かた]を学[まな]びます。
bank.explanation: Remember, ～方[かた] is attached to the stem form of the verb. Also, recall that 学[まな]ぶ means 'to learn'.

bank.question: Translate to Japanese: I will teach you how to cook sushi.
bank.sample_answer: 寿[す]司[し]の作[つく]り方[かた]を教[おし]えます。

bank.question: Which of the following is correct?
Fill in the blank: ピアノの____を習[なら]っています。
bank.explanation: The sentence translates to 'I am learning how to play the piano.' The correct word to fill in the blank is 弾[ひ]き方, which means 'how to play (an instrument)'.
